 In my opinion, the problem with regulating 'untrue opinions' is this: Who decides what is true? The administration currently in power? According to the Bush Administration, Iraq--currently under martial law--was a "mission accomplished", and any other opinion was untrue. And this isn't a partisan thing--similar statements could be made about any prior administration, Republican or Democrat.
 
 In American politics, determining the truth of a matter is up to us, its citizens. Fortunately, we all have access to a wide range of information sources that can help us triangulate in on the truth--assuming we can keep our minds open enough to recognize it when we see it.
